citation.article-title: Natranaerobius thermophilus gen. nov., sp. nov., a halophilic, alkalithermophilic bacterium from soda lakes of the Wadi An Natrun, Egypt, and proposal of Natranaerobiaceae fam. nov. and Natranaerobiales ord. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Natranaerobius [Natr.an.ae.ro′bi.us. N.Gr. n. natron derived from Arabic natrun soda (sodium carbonate); Gr. pref. an not; Gr. n. aer air; Gr. masc. n. bios life; N.L. masc. n. Natranaerobius a soda-requiring anaerobe].
Cells are Gram-type-positive; endospores are not observed.
Obligately halophilic (growth requires at least 3 M Na+); obligately alkaliphilic (no growth below pH 8.3).
Fatty acid profile is dominated by branched fatty acids with odd numbers of carbons; dimethylacetals are also present.
The DNA G+C content is approximately 40 mol%.
The type species is Natranaerobius thermophilus sp. nov.
